title: Promotional Strategy Effectiveness in Repeat-Purchase Service Industries
abstract: Meta-analysis of 47 promotional campaigns finds targeted promotions increase visit frequency by 28% but may reduce transaction value by 12%. Untargeted mass promotions show minimal impact (3% lift). Personalized offers based on purchase history drive 52% higher redemption rates.
key_findings: Targeted promotions: +28% visit frequency, -12% ticket size
Mass promotions: only 3% lift, poor ROI
Promotion fatigue sets in after 4 weekly offers
methods: Meta-analysis, controlled experiments, propensity score matching
